detaileddescription.para: How many times to repeat the requested number of iterations, hoping to find a better imbalance. This helps if it's easy to get stuck in a local minimum.

briefdescription.para: Whether to make migration choices deterministic.

detaileddescription.para: This will only lead to reproducibility when paired with deterministic object loads, for example when using a driver that feeds the load balancer object loads read from vt stats files.

briefdescription.para: Whether to roll back to the best iteration.

detaileddescription.para: If the final iteration of a trial has a worse imbalance than any earier iteration, it will roll back to the best iteration.

briefdescription.para: Whether to adjust the target load when we have a long pole.

detaileddescription.para: When an object load exceeds the processor-average load (i.e., we have a "long pole"), adjust the target load to be the maximum object load ("longest pole") instead of the processor-average load.

memberdef.argsstring: (ObjectOrderEnum obj_ordering, std::unordered_map< ObjIDType, TimeType > cur_objs, LoadType this_new_load, TimeType target_max_load)
memberdef.name: orderObjects
